meanings.definition: Treat with excessive care or kindness.
meanings.sent1: She was babying her injured puppy, making sure it had everything it needed to heal.
meanings.sent2: The grandmother couldn't help babying her grandchildren, always giving them treats and hugs.
meanings.sent3: Despite being a tough police officer, he couldn't resist babying his pet goldfish by talking to it every day.
meanings.sent4: The teacher was babying the delicate plant, watering it gently and ensuring it got enough sunlight.
meanings.sent5: The chef was babying the soufflé, carefully monitoring its rise in the oven.

meanings.sent1: After a long week, she decided to spend the day babying herself with a relaxing spa treatment.
meanings.sent2: The wealthy heiress enjoyed babying her pet poodle, buying it luxurious toys and treats.
meanings.sent3: He joked that he was babying his car by giving it a fancy wax and polish every weekend.
meanings.sent4: The hotel staff were babying the VIP guest, attending to their every need with utmost care.
meanings.sent5: The celebrity was used to people babying her, always ready to fulfill her every whim.

meanings.sent1: The actor was babying his co-star on set, making sure she had water and snacks between scenes.
meanings.sent2: She couldn't help babying her best friend when she was feeling down, offering comfort and support.
meanings.sent3: The coach was babying the star player, giving him extra attention during practice.
meanings.sent4: The babysitter was babying the toddler, playing games and singing lullabies to keep him entertained.
meanings.sent5: The nurse was babying the elderly patient, helping her with daily tasks and listening to her stories.
